body_html: I'm with Sam on this one. It seems really useful to glance at grad_fn in the repr, and it's not like a strict design pattern in Python-land for repr. How many times do we actually use the "repr is constructor" behavior, almost never.
body_text: I'm with Sam on this one. It seems really useful to glance at grad_fn in the repr, and it's not like a strict design pattern in Python-land for repr. How many times do we actually use the "repr is constructor" behavior, almost never.
body: I'm with Sam on this one. It seems really useful to glance at grad_fn in the repr, and it's not like a strict design pattern in Python-land for repr. How many times do we actually use the "repr is constructor" behavior, almost never.
